messages.message:
Is anyone else running into a bunch cypress issues?

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/10999512460/job/30543122768?pr=62911

I seem to be having issues fetching docs, fetching deployments, getting billing plans, etc

Your test is still in progress and so far no failures :slightly_smiling_face:. I'd recommend checking the Cypress Dashboard (using a shared account from 1pass if you can't use okta).
https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14136/overview?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1
Thanks! Looks like the Group SAML Mappings spec is a bit flakey. I guess I'll just re-run until it passes? Also, is there a way to re-run individual tests?
Seems like it's just a bunch of timeout issues
How old is your branch? Maybe try rebasing the latest master?
Thanks! I'll give that a go
Yea, it's trying to find a switch toggle in this modal. It should exist on the latest master.

ah, actually. I think the test itself is broken...
@Jessica For this test, we are overriding the `window.context.viewer_context.auth_type` to saml. However, the Cypress playback shows that the "SAML mapping" column is not showing up in the table. Probably this override wasn't applied somehow? Attaching a screenshot from st-aihub-dev (https://st-aihub-dev.internal.instabase.com/settings/organizations/st-aihub-dev-org-0412/groups)
@tony.shi can you rebase your branch? When I flipped SAML to GA I also changed this test to make sure it was using an enterprise account, and this run is using a commercial account

Seeing a few; Seems like a couple of timeouts and a server side error which has passed before. I'm guessing these are just flakey?
https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/14140/overview/a7551b61-b69b-4d06-9564-3ff64b763aaf?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1

Since the errors aren't related to the component that we're changing and cypress errors no longer block merging, we're planning to just merge the changes as is. Please let us know if it would be preferable to hold off instead. Thank you!!!
Go ahead and merge!! thanks for giving it a shot - trying to get these new tests less flaky!
